examples: Nick's earnings are not sufficient to cover all of his living expenses.

definitions: the money that a person, a region, a country, etc. earns from work, from investment, from business, etc.
examples: Anne has several sources of income. She has two part-time jobs and a small online business.

definitions: relating to money or the management of money
examples: Ben and his wife ran into financial difficulties when he lost his job shortly after they purchased a house.

definitions: the possibility that something bad might happen; a situation that could have a bad or dangerous result
examples: People who are exposed to too much sun are at higher risk of getting skin cancer.
The firefighter risked his life to save a woman and her children from the burning building.

definitions: relating to the physical features of a place and its location
examples: On this map, you can see the country's geographical features, including mountains, lakes, and rivers.

definitions: the study of the physical features of the earth and its atmosphere, and of human activity as it affects and is affected by these
examples: During geography class, we had to draw a map of the world and label as many countries as we could.

definitions: something between one thing or person and another that keeps them separate
examples: Poverty is often a barrier to higher education since many people cannot afford to spend their time and money on college.
As Tom suggested, having another employee to help out will indeed take some pressure off us.

definitions: a particular situation that makes it possible to do or achieve something
examples: When Lisa makes a mistake, she always takes it as an opportunity for growth and learning.
